task.title: IAM Group Details
task.shortdesc: Eucalyptus allows you to manage user permissions using IAM users and groups. This page allows you to view and edit an IAM group.

step.cmd: Type the group name into the Name text field.

taskbody.context: To add a user to a group:

step.cmd: Click the Users drop-down list box and select a user from the list. An icon with the user's name will appear on the page.
Click the Add User to Group button.

task.title: Remove the user from a group

taskbody.context: To remove the user from a group:

step.cmd: Click on the X icon to the right of the user icon.

task.title: Add a policy
task.shortdesc: An IAM access policy allows you to explicitly define permissions over what your users and groups can access.

step.cmd: Click on the Add Policy button to bring up the Add Access Policy page.

task.title: Actions menu
task.shortdesc: Clicking the Actions button brings up a menu of actions that you can perform on the selected image.

taskbody.context: The following context menu actions are available:

step.cmd: This item allows you to delete the group.

info.note: This action deletes a group an all permissions associated with the group. Selecting this item will display a confirmation dialog.

step.cmd: Click the Save Changes button to save your work, or click the Cancel button to cancel the operation.
